newsitem.title: UK: UniChem casts doubt on Gehe bid for Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: UniChem casts doubt on Gehe bid for Lloyds.

text.p: Britain's UniChem Plc said on Tuesday it believed that German drug wholesaler Gehe AG could obtain less value from Lloyds Chemists Plc in on-going cost savings and revenue benefits than UniChem.
Earlier, Gehe announced it was offering 500p in cash for each share in Lloyds Chemists and 322.6p in cash for each Lloyds preference share, valuing the company at 650.6 million pounds.
UniChem, which launched a fresh bid for Lloyds in October of 657.6 million pounds in cash and shares, said the underlying value of Lloyds remained unchanged.

"UniChem is uniquely positioned to deliver value from the acquisition of Lloyds Chemists. Only our offers allow Lloyds Chemists shareholders to participate in this value," said UniChem in a statement.
Gehe has been locked in a takeover battle for Lloyds with UniChem since submitting an original offer earlier this year for Lloyds of 650 million in cash.
